image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: US national security adviser Jake Sullivan expresses worry over escalating tension in Middle East
Hungarian intel agency interviews CEO with pager link
Weaponising ordinary devices violates international law: UNHR chief
Kamala Harris accepts CNN invite for second presidential debate
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are scheduled for a second presidential debate on October 23, organized by CNN. Harris's campaign stressed the significance of another debate for voters' assessment. The format mirrors their previous encounter, which Trump commended. The Trump campaign has not yet issued a response.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mark Robinson's lewd comments removed after CNN report
item.description: Mark Robinson, the Republican candidate for North Carolina governor, faces criticism following a CNN report uncovering offensive comments he made on a pornographic website. Although there are calls for him to withdraw from the race against Democrat Josh Stein, he remains on the ballot. The issue has garnered attention from both Trump and Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why is Cards Against Humanity suing Elon Musk's SpaceX?
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 18-year-old woman arrested after crushing man under wheels of his own Porsche, see video
item.description: An 18-year-old Canadian woman named Sarah Badshaw has been arrested for stealing a Porsche and injuring its owner in Mississauga. Captured on a doorbell camera, she faces charges like dangerous operation causing bodily harm and theft. The stolen vehicle was later found abandoned in the same area.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 10 disturbing comments made by 'Black Nazi' Mark Robinson
item.description: Mark Robinson, North Carolinaâ€™s Lieutenant Governor and Republican gubernatorial candidate, is facing backlash over controversial comments made on a pornography website years ago. His remarks include identifying as a 'black NAZI,' advocating for slavery, using derogatory language towards multiple communities, and displaying hypocrisy regarding abortion. These revelations cast doubt on his suitability for office.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Two dead, three hurt after a shooting in downtown Minneapolis
item.description: Early Saturday, a shooting in downtown Minneapolis left two men dead and three others injured, including two teenage girls. The violence erupted from a fight between groups of people. One person was arrested on suspicion of inciting a riot. Authorities plan to increase patrols in collaboration with local law enforcement agencies.

item.title: Court gives 5 days for X to validate its Brazil legal representative
item.description: The Brazilian Supreme Court has mandated Elon Musk's social platform X to submit documents within five days validating its newly appointed legal representative in Brazil. This comes after the court ordered a block on X for failing to comply with local laws, including appointing a legal representative, following the closure of its offices and dismissal of staff.

item.title: Trump to visit North Carolina amid Mark Robinson scandal
item.description: Donald Trump will visit North Carolina without Republican gubernatorial candidate Mark Robinson, who faces allegations of making controversial remarks. Despite denying these claims, some Republicans worry that Robinson's candidacy could impact Trump's chances in the battleground state. Democrats are capitalizing on this controversy by linking Trump to Robinson in their campaign ads.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Allegations against Al Fayed didn't come as 'biggest surprise': former manager says staff aware about ownerâ€™s interest in â€˜young, blond girls'
item.description: Gaute Haugenes, former Fulham manager, disclosed that female players were safeguarded from the clubâ€™s late owner Mohamed Al Fayed due to his interest in young, blond girls. A BBC documentary unveiled multiple allegations of assault and rape against Fayed by ex-Harrods employees. Fulham is currently investigating if any staff members were affected.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 5.3 magnitude earthquake strikes Taiwan's east coast
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China's 'beautiful governor' infamous for having multiple affairs with subordinates, arrested
item.description: Zhong Yang, ex-governor of Qiannan prefecture in Guizhou province, was sentenced to 13 years in prison and fined one million Yuan for misconduct. She accepted nearly 60 million yuan in bribes and engaged in inappropriate relationships with 58 subordinates. Zhong has been expelled from the Communist Party and stripped of her roles.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'She's very busy,' says Harris' advisor as MAGA accuses her of avoiding interviews
item.description: Keisha Lance Bottoms, senior adviser to Kamala Harris, explained that Harris's limited media engagement is due to her busy schedule as vice president and presidential candidate. Despite criticism from Donald Trump, Harris has conducted multiple interviews and addressed significant issues like reproductive freedom in various formats.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Airplane makes emergency landing after passenger finds live-mouse in meal
item.description: A Scandinavian Airlines flight traveling from Oslo to MÃ¡laga was diverted to Copenhagen after a passenger found a live mouse in his meal. Following safety protocols, the pilot made an emergency landing due to the potential hazard of rodents on board. Passengers were later transferred to another flight, resulting in only a minor delay.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: South Korea arrests trainee doctor over 'blacklist' of non-striking colleagues
item.description: A South Korean doctor was arrested for allegedly making and sharing a blacklist of colleagues who did not join the ongoing walkout over medical training reforms. The strike has severely disrupted healthcare services. The government plans to increase medical school admissions to address doctor shortages, but doctors argue it will lower service quality.

item.title: Robert F Kennedy Jr's wife furious over his alleged sexting scandal: Report
item.description: Cheryl Hines is reportedly fuming over her husband Robert F Kennedy Jr's alleged sexting scandal with reporter Olivia Nuzzi, which began during his presidential campaign. New York Magazine placed Nuzzi on leave for violating conflict of interest standards. The Kennedy family has distanced themselves from Robert, raising doubts about the couple's future.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: Letâ€™s not pay too much attention to the polls, says Kamala Harris
item.description: At a rally in Wisconsin, vice president Kamala Harris urged supporters to focus on hard work rather than polls, identifying herself as an underdog. She emphasized unity and community-building in her campaign. With 46 days until the election, Harris holds a narrow lead over Trump nationally and in the key battleground state of Wisconsin.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Top Hezbollah commander Ahmed Wahbi killed in Israeli strike
item.description: Hezbollah reported that its top commander Ahmed Wahbi was killed in an Israeli airstrike on Beirut suburbs. The strike also took out Ibrahim Aqil, head of Hezbollah's Radwan unit. In retaliation, Hezbollah fired rockets into northern Israel. This escalation follows Hamas's attack on October 7 and has now reached Lebanon.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
